caption: Figure A1: Over 70% of NYPD complaints are not substantiated. This supports the claim that the accountability system fails to effectively address public concerns.
Figure A2: In the top 5 precincts with the most complaints, unsubstantiated cases greatly outnumber substantiated ones.
Figure B1: Many precincts show relatively high substantiation rates, suggesting complaints are being addressed.
Figure B2: Substantiated complaints are widely distributed, implying accountability across the city.
